newsitem.title: INDIA: END-ACCOUNT FACTORS WEAKEN BOMBAY STOCKS.
newsitem.headline: END-ACCOUNT FACTORS WEAKEN BOMBAY STOCKS.

text.p: Share prices finished lower on Thursday dragged down by close of weekly account and long weekend holidays, brokers said.
They said activity was sluggish with most participants parked on the sidelines.
"People don't want to take positions over the long weekend. There's nothing substantial happening," said Ashith Kampani, head of dealing at JM Share & Stock Brokers.
Indian stock markets is closed on Friday for Independence Day holiday. The Bombay Stock Exchange is also closed on Monday due to a religious holiday.
